level.heading: Winding up and termination.
level.text: Winding up and termination of an unincorporated nonprofit association shall proceed in accordance with the following rules:
All known debts and liabilities shall be paid or adequately provided for.
Any property subject to a condition requiring return to the person designated by the donor shall be transferred to that person.
Any property subject to a trust shall be distributed in accordance with the trust agreement.
Any remaining property shall be distributed as follows:
As required by law other than this chapter that requires assets of an association to be distributed to another person with similar nonprofit purposes;
In accordance with the association's governing principles or, in the absence of applicable governing principles, to the members of the association per capita or as the members direct; or
If subparagraph (A) or (B) of this paragraph does not apply, in accordance with the law of unclaimed property in the District.

level.heading: Section References
level.text: This section is referenced in § 29-1122 and § 29-1124.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 18-378
level.text: For history of Law 18-378, see notes under § 29-101.01.

level.heading: Editor’s Notes
level.text: Uniform Law: This section is based on § 29 of the Uniform Unincorporated Nonprofit Association Act (2008 Act).
